  "article_text": [
    "during the last 20 years , many authors studied singularly continuous probability measures generated by different expansions of real numbers ( see , e.g. , @xcite ) .",
    "all these measures are the distributions of random variables of the form @xmath5 where @xmath6 are independent or markovian , and @xmath7 stands for some expansion of real numbers . for the case of expansions over finite alphabets , fractal properties of the spectra of the corresponding measures",
    "are relatively well studied . for the case of infinite alphabets ,",
    "the situation is essentially more complicated . in @xcite and @xcite",
    ", it has been shown that even for self - similar @xmath0-expansion and for i.i.d .",
    "case , the hausdorff  besicovitch dimension of the corresponding spectra can not be calculated in a traditional way ( as a root of the corresponding equation ) , and formulae for the hausdorff dimension of the measure @xmath8 are also unknown .    in this paper , we generalize results from @xcite and @xcite for the case of distributions of random variables with independent identically distributed gls digits @xmath9 and get general formulae for the determination of the hausdorff  besicovitch dimension of spectra of @xmath10 for the case where all but countably many points from the unit interval belong to the basis cylinders of gls - expansion .",
    "let @xmath11 be an infinite stochastic vector with positive coordinates .",
    "let us consider a countable sequence @xmath12 $ ] of intervals such that @xmath13 and @xmath14 .",
    "the sets @xmath15 are said to be cylinders of gls - expansion ( generalized lroth series ) .",
    "let us remark that the placement of cylinders of rank 1 is completely determined by the preselected procedure .    for every cylinder @xmath16 of rank 1 , we consider a sequence of nonoverlapping closed intervals @xmath17 such that @xmath18 and the placement of @xmath19 in @xmath16 is the same as @xmath16 in @xmath20 $ ] .",
    "the closed intervals @xmath19 are said to be cylinders of rank 2 of the gls - expansion .",
    "similarly , for every cylinder of rank @xmath21 @xmath22 , we consider the sequence of nonoverlapping closed intervals @xmath23 such that @xmath24 and the placement of @xmath25 in @xmath26 is the same as @xmath16 in @xmath20 $ ] .",
    "the closed intervals @xmath25 are said to be cylinders of rank @xmath27 of the gls - expansion . from the construction",
    "it follows that @xmath28 where @xmath29 .",
    "so , for any sequence of indices @xmath30 ( @xmath31 , there exists the sequence of embedded closed intervals @xmath32 with @xmath33 .",
    "therefore , there exists a unique point @xmath34 $ ] that belongs to all these cylinders .",
    "conversely , if @xmath34 $ ] belongs to some cylinder of rank @xmath35 for any @xmath36 and @xmath37 is not an end - point for any cylinder , then there exists a unique sequence of the cylinders @xmath38 containing @xmath37 , and @xmath39 the latter expression is called the gls - expansion of @xmath37 ( see , e.g. , @xcite for details ) .    let us remark that the lroth expansion and @xmath0-expansion @xcite are particular cases of the gls - expansion . for the case where the ratio of lengths of two embedded cylinders of successive ranks depends on the last index and it is a power of @xmath40 , we get the @xmath1-expansion of @xmath37 @xcite .",
    "let @xmath41 be a stochastic vector with positive coordinates , and let @xmath42 be the gls - expansion of @xmath43 $ ] .",
    "let @xmath6 be a sequence of independent identically distributed random variables : @xmath44 where @xmath45    using the sequence @xmath6 and a given gls - expansion , let us consider the random variable @xmath46 which is said to be the random variable with independent identically distributed gls - symbols .",
    "let @xmath8 be the corresponding probability measure .    to investigate metric , topological , and fractal properties of the spectrum of the random variable with independent identically distributed gls - symbols , let us study properties of the following family of sets .",
    "let @xmath47 be a subset of @xmath48 , and let @xmath49=\\bigl\\{x : x=\\vardelta^{\\mathit{gls}}_{\\alpha_1(x)\\dots\\alpha_k(x)\\dots},\\alpha _ k \\in v\\bigr\\}.\\ ] ]    if the set @xmath47 is finite , then @xmath2 $ ] is a self - similar set satisfying the open set condition ( see , e.g. , @xcite ) .",
    "so , its hausdorff  besicovitch dimension coincides with the root of the equation @xmath50    if the set @xmath47 is countable , then the situation is essentially more complicated .",
    "in particular , there exist stochastic vectors @xmath4 and subsets @xmath47 such that equation has no roots on the unit interval .    for example ,",

    "let @xmath165 be the set of those @xmath166 $ ] that do not belong to any cylinder of the first rank of the gls - expansion .",
    "the set @xmath165 can be empty , countable , or of continuum cardinality .",
    "let us recall that the nonempty and bounded set @xmath167 is called @xmath168-self - similar if it can be represented as a union of a countably many sets @xmath169 such that the set @xmath167 is similar to the sets @xmath170 with coefficient  @xmath171 .",
    "since the spectrum @xmath172 of the distribution of a random variable @xmath173 with independent identically distributed gls - symbols is a self - similar or @xmath168-self - similar set and @xmath174)^{\\mathit{cl}}$ ] , we can apply the above results to calculate the hausdorff ",
    "besicovitch dimension of the spectrum @xmath172 for the case where @xmath165 is an at most countable set .",
    "so , we get the following theorem , which can be considered as a corollary of theorems  [ thm1 ] and  [ thm2 ] .",

    "the author expresses her sincere gratitude to the referee for useful comments and remarks ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we study properties of distributions of random variables with independent identically distributed symbols of generalized lroth series ( gls ) expansions ( the family of gls - expansions contains lroth expansion and @xmath0- and @xmath1-expansions ) . to this end </S>",
    "<S> , we explore fractal properties of the family of cantor - like sets @xmath2 $ ] consisting of real numbers whose gls - expansions contain only symbols from some countable set @xmath3 , and derive exact formulae for the determination of the hausdorff  besicovitch dimension of @xmath2 $ ] . based on these results , </S>",
    "<S> we get general formulae for the hausdorff  besicovitch dimension of the spectra of random variables with independent identically distributed gls - symbols for the case where all but countably many points from the unit interval belong to the basis cylinders of gls - expansions .    ./style / arxiv - vmsta.cfg    random variables with independent gls - symbols,@xmath4-expansion , n - self - similar sets , hausdorff  besicovitch dimension 11k55,28a80 </S>"
  ]
}
